page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: The majority of houses in this area are under a hundred years old and very few are over two hundred years old. Many are old farmhouses or cottages which belonged to the farm estates, used for housing the farm labourers, but they have now been renovated or modernised. Farm buildings have been turned into houses and there is a house which was a Methodist Chapel. The main material for roofing is tiles. Blue tiles are used as they seem to be of a better quality than the red tiles which were brought in around 100 years ago. Double glazing and insulation have been innovations into houses in the last ten years. Double glazing is used for windows and doors to prevent draughts. Insulation is in the form of foam in the roof and between the cavities of outside and inside walls.
